{"step_by_step_thinking": "Pazopanib is a type of medication known as a tyrosine kinase inhibitor, which is used to treat kidney cancer and soft tissue sarcoma. However, when it comes to glioblastoma, a type of brain cancer, the effectiveness of pazopanib is not well established. Some studies have shown that it may have some effect, but it is not considered a standard treatment for this type of cancer.", "answer_choice": "B"}
